intro: Leandra dichotoma var. villosissima, commonly known as the hairy leandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and large, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or red. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its unique morphology and ornamental value make it a subject of interest in both botanical research and horticulture.
